alert.note: Alert for Eddy; Lea (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 24 at 4:06PM MDT until May 24 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Eddy County in southeastern New Mexico... Lea County in southeastern New Mexico... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 403 PM MDT, a cold front was producing widespread strong winds and blowing dust along a line from western Eddy county through the southern half of Lea county, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar and trained spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. Locations impacted include... Hobbs, Carlsbad, Lovington, Eunice, Jal, Loving, Monument, Humble City, Avalon, Maljamar, Eunice Airport, Seven Rivers Airport, Jal Airport, Nadine, Brantley Lake State Park, Carlsbad Caverns National Park, Malaga, Carlsbad North, Whites City and Lincoln National Forest. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
